<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#13756](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/13756.html) (wallet: "avoid_reuse" wallet flag for impro

Unsure about this... what is the long term use case for the stored data? Would it eventually be more straight forward to give steps how to keep the BIP70 data in a release notes (once completely removed)?\nOr would altering "dumpwallet" with an option to dump the BIP70 stuff make sense?
The BIP70 stuff is currently stored in a protobuf-encoded format IIRC, so accessing it post-removal or even from RPC would be invasive.

I think this makes some sense in context of deprecating BIP70. The data should remain in the wallet (for legal/historical purposes) but will effectively become inaccessible. \nMigrating it to another field makes sure that something of the historical metadata is visible even after BIP70 parsing is removed.
closing in favor of #16852 (if it works)
